definition: to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)

sentences.english: There are difficulties, but being defeatist can't help.
sentences.chinese: 困難總會有，但是認輸氣餒卻於事無補。

sentences.english: Let the heaven know my gameness.
Afterwards, they have to admit defeat and make an unserious self-criticism.
sentences.chinese: 隨後就是認輸，做一點自我批評。

sentences.english: 1970 – Biafra capitulates, ending the Nigerian civil war.
sentences.chinese: 1970年的今天，比夫拉認輸，尼日利亞內戰結束。

sentences.english: Fu strong woman will admit defeat, but will not admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 乀堅強的女人會認輸，但不會服輸。

sentences.english: Everyone has to bow before the selfless time.
sentences.chinese: 在大公無私的時間前面，誰也不能不低頭認輸。

sentences.english: The project was ridiculous. Time to admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 看來我的計劃不切實際，是認輸的時候了。

sentences.english: Yet perhaps it is too early for the English-speaking democracies to throw in the towel.
sentences.chinese: 然而，或許以英語爲母語的民主國家認輸還言之過早。

sentences.english: Claud quickened up, a man wouldn't give the battle.
sentences.chinese: 克勞德加快了速度，男子漢是不會認輸的。

sentences.english: I stood aside, so I hauled down my colours.
sentences.chinese: 我退出競選，我認輸投降。

sentences.english: Never accept failure, no matter how offten it visits you. Keep on going. never give up. Never.
sentences.chinese: 即使再多失敗也不能認輸，堅持不懈，永不放棄。

sentences.english: They had to quit when they became aware of the fact that they could not win the game.
sentences.chinese: 他們在覺察到不可能打贏這場比賽時，只好認輸。

sentences.english: Do not think for a minute that power concedes.
sentences.chinese: 一時一刻都不要以爲執政黨認輸了。

sentences.english: With that said, companies cannot afford to throw up their hands and give up in the face of unpredictably.
sentences.chinese: 因此，公司不能在無法預知的事態前就認輸甚至放棄。

sentences.english: Later they admit defeat and do a little self-criticism.
sentences.chinese: 隨後就是認輸，做一點自我批評。

sentences.english: I give up. Tell me the answer.
sentences.chinese: 我認輸了，告訴我答案吧。

definition: to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to sway/to waver/to rock/to rattle/to destabilize/to pose a challenge to
to take troubles to heart (idiom); brooding
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
see 沒關係|没关系[mei2 guan1 xi5]
to err/to make a mistake/to do the wrong thing
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
whatever the case/in any event/no matter what/by all possible means
